Description: Wooden shabti-box in the form of a shrine, rectangular with a cornice-top. The lid is missing. The external surfaces are covered with polychrome decoration on a layer of plaster.The long sides bear representations of a king and the Souls of Pe and Nekhen. On one end the god Ra-Horakhty is shown, and on the other a scene of Horus and Thoth making libations. Each long side of the box has symmetrically-placed holes, probably for the attachment of carrying-poles.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. Tillier, 'Portable chests for the falcon cults of Akhmim, MDAIK 72 (2016), 239-51.
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
